Detailed Description

An SMS a user can send to share an activity.

JREmailObject is a simple container object for a pre-composed SMS to be attached to a JRActivityObject.

Instantiate a new JRSmsObject with a body. Optionally, add a list of URLs from the body and Engage will automatically shorten them, track click-throughs and provide analytics on your dashboard.

See JRActivityObject, JREmailObject

Constructor

JRSmsObject (  ) 

Create an empty SMS object.

JRSmsObject ( String  body  ) 

Create an SMS object with a given body.

Parameters:
body The SMS's body, which will be appended to the user's comment and passed to the devices SMS application.

List<String> getUrls (  ) 

Return the SMS's list of URLs to be shortened.

Returns:
An immutable list of URLs to be shortened.
See also:
JRSmsObject.setUrls(java.util.List)
void setUrls ( List< String >  urls  ) 

Set the SMS's list of URLs to be shortened. Each of these URLs will be shortened to an rpx.me URL which tracks click-throughs and provides analytics. Once shortened, the Engage for Android library will substitute the shortened version for the original long version for each URL found in the body of the SMS.

Parameters:
urls The SMS's list of URLs to be shortened, not more than five URLs.
See also:
JRSmsObject.addUrl(String)
void addUrl ( String  url  ) 

Add a single URL to the list of URLs to shorten.

Parameters:
url The URL to add to the list of URLs to shorten.
See also:
JRSmsObject.setUrls(java.util.List)
